intro: Sebastiania hispida var. klotzschiana, commonly known as the Klotzschiana sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Mexico and Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, which are often dispersed by wind.
